alert.note: Alert for Lafayette; Northern Acadia; St. Landry (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 26 at 6:06PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN LAFAYETTE... NORTHEASTERN ACADIA AND SOUTH CENTRAL ST. LANDRY PARISHES THROUGH 630 PM CST... At 606 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Branch, or near Church Point, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to vegetation and outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Opelousas, Rayne, Carencro, Church Point, Leonville, Arnaudville, Sunset, Grand Coteau, Cankton, Mire, Lawtell, Branch, and Richard. This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 3 and 24. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
